kpis.description: Total return on investments measures the overall profitability of an investment relative to its cost. It includes both income generated and capital gains.
kpis.formula: (Net Profit from Investment / Initial Investment Cost) * 100

kpis.kpi: percent increase in revenue after deducting costs
kpis.description: This KPI measures the percentage increase in revenue after accounting for costs, indicating the effectiveness of revenue generation relative to expenses.
kpis.formula: ((Revenue After Costs - Previous Revenue After Costs) / Previous Revenue After Costs) * 100

kpis.description: The cost to sales ratio indicates the proportion of costs incurred to generate sales, helping assess operational efficiency.
This KPI shows the percentage of net profit relative to total revenue, indicating how much profit is generated from total sales.
The debt to equity ratio measures a company's financial leverage by comparing its total liabilities to its shareholders' equity.
